CONCLUSION: No violation of Article 6 - Right to a fair trial;No violation of Article 1 of Protocol No. 1 - Protection of property
JUDGES: Giovanni Bonello;Ján Šikuta;Lech Garlicki;Mihai Poalelungi;Nebojša Vučinić;Nicolas Bratza
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicants , Mr PERSON , Mr PERSON and Mr PERSON are brothers . They are NORP nationals who were born in DATE and DATE respectively and live in GPE and GPE .

CARDINAL . The applicants are heirs of the owner of CARDINAL plots of land and buildings , which constituted a property called “ FAC Kolonie Fabryczne ” . The property was de facto expropriated by the ORG by virtue of the DATE ORG in DATE .

CARDINAL . NORP However , in this particular case the relevant authorities failed to issue an appropriate administrative decision , declaring that the property had been subject to expropriation within the framework of the agrarian reform .
CARDINAL . NORP In DATE ORG title to the property was entered in the land and mortgage register .
CARDINAL . In respect of plots CARDINAL . CARDINAL and DATE , the right of perpetual use of these plots was granted by ORG to GPE . The plots were leased to certain individuals .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicants requested the GPE Governor to issue a decision stating that the property “ FAC Kolonie Fabryczne ” should not have been subject to expropriation under section CARDINAL § CARDINAL ( e ) of the DATE ORG .

CARDINAL . On DATE the FAC Governor partly dismissed the applicants’ request , finding that a part of the property had met the criteria for expropriation set out in the CARDINAL Decree . However , the Governor declared that several plots of land with an overall area of CARDINAL hectares should not have been subject to expropriation . This decision concerned , among others , plots nos . CARDINAL and CARDINAL .
CARDINAL . On DATE the Minister of Agriculture dismissed the applicants’ appeal in respect of the remainder of the decision .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG dismissed the ORG further appeal , finding that the contested administrative decisions of the GPE Governor and the Minister of Agriculture had been lawful .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicants instituted civil proceedings for rectification of an entry in the land and mortgage register . They requested the court to enter their ownership title to plots nos . CARDINAL and CARDINAL in the land and mortgage register . Hearings were held on DATE and DATE .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG gave a decision , securing the applicants’ claims by entering a caveat in the land and mortgage register . Subsequently , the court stayed the proceedings pending the outcome of the above administrative proceedings .

CARDINAL . On DATE , following the delivery of the FAC Governor ’s decision of DATE ( see paragraph CARDINAL above ) , the applicants requested that the proceedings be resumed in the part concerning the following plots : CARDINAL ) nos . CARDINAL , DATE , CARDINAL and DATE ; CARDINAL ) nos . ORG and ORG ; CARDINAL ) no . DATE .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG delivered a partial judgment in respect of the plots listed under CARDINAL ) nos . CARDINAL , DATE , CARDINAL and DATE and CARDINAL ) CARDINAL . CARDINAL and DATE . On DATE , after the judgment in this part became final , ORG entered the applicants’ ownership title in the relevant land register .

CARDINAL . On DATE of the parties to the proceedings applied for the proceedings in respect of plots nos . CARDINAL and CARDINAL to be re - opened , arguing that new facts had arisen which showed that the applicants’ father had not owned the plots in question .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG re - opened the proceedings in respect of plots nos . CARDINAL and DATE .

CARDINAL . On DATE the court stayed the re - opening proceedings pending the outcome of civil proceedings concerning the ownership title to these plots before ORG , and subsequently , before ORG . On DATE ORG , following an appeal by the applicants , dismissed the ORG ’s ORG claim and discontinued the proceedings .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG resumed the proceedings for re - opening the proceedings terminated by the judgment of DATE ( see paragraph CARDINAL above ) .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG gave judgment in the case . It dismissed the motion for re - opening the proceedings .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicants lodged an action for recovery of plots nos . CARDINAL and CARDINAL .

CARDINAL . At the first hearing , on DATE , ORG stayed the proceedings pending the outcome of the proceedings for rectification of an entry in the land and mortgage register ( see paragraphs CARDINAL - CARDINAL above ) .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicants appealed against that decision . On DATE ORG dismissed the applicants’ interlocutory appeal .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicants requested that the proceedings be resumed .
CARDINAL . On DATE the Końskie ORG resumed the proceedings .

CARDINAL . On DATE a third party asked the court to allow her to participate in the proceedings as intervenor . She alleged that the applicants’ father had not been the owner of the plots in question since she and her husband had been in possession of the disputed plots since DATE .

CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG stayed the proceedings , indicating that the proceedings for rectification of an entry in the land register had been re - opened in their part concerning the applicants’ claim . On DATE ORG dismissed the applicants’ interlocutory appeal , finding that the lower court ’s decision was correct .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicants requested the court to resume the proceedings . On DATE the ORG resumed the proceedings and discontinued them since the applicants had withdrawn their action .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicants instituted civil proceedings for compensation for the use of their property by ORG without valid legal title . They claimed compensation for the period from CARDINAL DATE .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG gave judgment in the case . On DATE ORG upheld the first - instance judgment . Following a cassation appeal lodged by ORG , on DATE ORG quashed the second - instance judgment and remitted the case .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG held a hearing in the case . At the hearing the applicants withdrew their claim in respect of plots nos . CARDINAL and CARDINAL .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG discontinued the proceedings in respect of the abovementioned plots since the applicants had withdrawn their claims .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicants sold plots nos . CARDINAL and CARDINAL party .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicants lodged a complaint with ORG under LAW of DATE on complaints about a breach of the right to trial within a reasonable time ( “ the GPE ” ) . The applicants claimed just satisfaction in the amount of PLN MONEY ( approx . EUR CARDINAL ) . They also requested the court to take action to resume and expedite the proceedings for recovery of the property ( see paragraphs CARDINAL above ) .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG dismissed the ORG complaint . The court referred to the fact that there had been no undue delay in the proceedings on and after the date of entry into force of the LAW on DATE . The court pointed out that the proceedings had been stayed pending the outcome of other proceedings ( see paragraphs CARDINAL and CARDINAL - CARDINAL above ) in which the ownership of the property was in issue . Therefore , there had been no delays in dealing with the case .

CARDINAL . The relevant domestic law and practice concerning remedies for the excessive length of judicial proceedings , in particular the applicable provisions of LAW , are set out in the ORG ’s decisions in the cases of ORG v. GPE no . MONEY ( dec . ) , § § CARDINAL , ECHR CARDINAL-V , and NORP v. GPE no . CARDINAL ( dec . ) , ORG CARDINAL-VIII , and the judgment in the case of PERSON v. GPE , no . CARDINAL , § § DATE , ECHR CARDINAL-V.

CARDINAL . The relevant domestic law and practice concerning LAW No . CARDINAL is set out in the ORG ’s judgments in the cases of PERSON v. GPE , no . CARDINAL , § CARDINAL , ORG CARDINAL-VI , and PERSON v. GPE , no . MONEY , judgment of CARDINAL DATE .
